content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, everyone except Phoebe is there as Rachel enters carrying a magazine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, I’m in my apartment doing the Soap Opera Digest crossword puzzle, and guess who the clue is for three down. (She hands the magazine to Joey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Three down, Days Of Our Lives star blank Tribbiani. That’s me!! I’m blank!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How cool is this?! We know three down! I’m touching three down! (She has her hand on his shoulder.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah you are baby.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Three down knows I’m married, what’s three down doin’?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So did they call you to tell you your name’s gonna be in this?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No. They really like me over there. They want to do a big profile on me, but I said no.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why’d you say no?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Remember what happened the last time I did an interview for them? I said I write a lot of my own lines, and then the writers got mad and made my character fall down the elevator shaft. So who knows what I might say this time.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If only there was something in your head to control the things you say. (Joey nods his agreement.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, come on Joey! You will totally keep it in check this time, and plus y’know the publicity would be really good for your career! And you deserve that! And if you do the interview you can mention, oh I don’t know, gal pal Rachel Green?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is that gal pal spelled L-O-S-E-R?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, don’t listen to him. Please?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Fine! All right, I’ll do it. But hey! You guys have to be at the next table so you can stop me if I y’know, start to say something stupid.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Just then or-or all the time, ‘cause we-we have jobs y’know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on! We will be there for you the whole time! Just remember gal pal Rachel Green. (Excited) Ha-ha! I’m gonna be in Soap Opera Digest ! And not just in the dumb crossword puzzle. (Looks at Joey.) Seriously, proud of you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.description: Central Perk, Joey is there for his interview and everyone but Phoebe are hiding on the couch.

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: I really appreciate you taking the time to do this.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, not at all. Happy to do it.
[Cut to the rest of the gang sitting low on the couch and craning their necks to watch the interview.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You think we’re being obvious?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, we’re just four people with neck problems. You talk like this. (Out of the sides of their mouths.)
[Cut to the interview.]

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: Y’know I think its great you wanted to meet here. Y’know when most people hear the magazine is paying for it they want to go to a big fancy restaurant.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Actually, I didn’t know the magazine was paying for it. Wouldn’t have mattered, I’m doing this for the fans, not for the free food.
Gunther: Can I get you anything?

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: Umm, I’ll have a cup of coffee.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And I’ll have all the muffins.
[Cut to the gang.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Shhh! We’re not talking.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. Finally! Oh. (Sits back in relief.)
[Cut to the interview.]

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: So, according to your bio, you’ve done quite a bit of work before Days of Our Lives . Anything you’re particularly proud of?
[This starts a series of flashbacks; the first one is from Episode 106: The One With The Butt, Joey is in a play called Freud!.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.parenthetical: He goes into a song and dance number

content.text: [The next one is from Episode 304: The One With The Metaphorical Tunnel, Joey is on Amazing Discoveries.]

content.speaker: Host
content.text: Folks, has this ever happened to you. You go to the refrigerator to get a nice glass of milk, (Joey is in the background struggling to open a cartoon of milk) and these darn cartons are so flingin’-flangin’ hard to open.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, you said it Mike. (Rips open the carton and spills milk on the counter) Aw! There’s got to be a better way!

content.speaker: Mike
content.text: And there is Kevin.
[Cut forward.]

content.speaker: Mike
content.text: This is the first time he’s ever used this product, he’s never used this product before, you’re gonna see how easy this is to do. (To Kevin) Go ahead. (’Kevin’ starts using the product, it is a spout that you jab into a paper milk carton so that you don’t have to rip it open.) This works with any milk carton.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow, it is easy. (Starts to poor the milk) Now, I can have milk everyday.
(The crowd ahhs.)
[The next one is from Episode 322: The One With The Screamer, it’s the end of Joey’s play.]

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: So this is it? Victor?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I guess it is. And so… I’m gonna get on this spaceship, (Smoke starts pouring in from the ceiling, and a ladder comes down, with flashing, colored lights on the side of it) and I’m gonna go to Blargon 7 in search of alternative fuels. But when I return, 200 years from now, you’ll be long gone. But I won’t have aged at all. (Gets on the ladder) So you tell your great-great-granddaughter to look me up, because Adrienne… baby…I’m gonna want to meet her.
(The ladder retracts, taking Joey up into the spaceship for his voyage to Blargon 7.)
[The next one is from Episode 204: The One With Phoebe’s Husband, when everyone including Julie is watching Joey in his porno.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Shh, OK, here I come, here I come. See I’m comin’ to fix the copier, I can’t get to the copier, I’m thinkin’ what do I do, what do I do…so I just watch ’em have sex. And then I say, wait, here’s my line, (Joey from TV) you know that’s bad for the paper tray .

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nice work my friend.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank you. Wait-wait-wait-wait, you see me again. Hang on, the guy’s butt’s blockin’ me. There I am, there I am, there I am, there I am, there I am…
[Cut to the interview.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, there are so many things, it’s hard to pick just one.
[Cut to the gang.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m gonna get some coffee, anyone want anything?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah, I’d actually love a blueberry muffin and a chamomile tea.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, double latte, extra foam.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And a bagel with only…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I was just being polite!
[Cut to the interview.]

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: Okay, how about when you’re not working. What do you do in your spare time?
[This starts another series of flashbacks about Joey’s hobbies. The first one is from Episode 703: The One With Phoebe’s Cookies, Rachel is teaching Joey how to sail his boat, the Mr. Bowmont.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look at this clown! Just because he’s got a bigger boat he thinks he can take up the whole river. (Yelling) Get out of the way jackass! (To Rachel) Who names their boat Coast Guard anyway?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That is the Coast Guard.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are they doing out here? The coast’s all the way over there. (Points to the coast.)
[The next one is from Episode 603: The One With Ross’s Denial, Joey is amazing Phoebe and Monica by holding his breath.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! Check it out! This is unbelievable! Joey has been holding his breath for almost four minutes!
(We see Joey who has puffed up his cheeks and Chandler nonchalantly reaches down and pinches Joey’s nose shut. In a few seconds, Joey has to move because he’s now forced to actually hold his breath.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude! What are yo—you trying to kill me?!
[The next one is from Episode 507: The One Where Ross Moves In.]

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s and Ross’s, Chandler is entering and when he closes the door Joey pops his head out of the fort like before, but this time he’s wearing a cowboy hat.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I see you’ve had a very productive day. Don’t you think the cowboy hat is a little much?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, it’s fun!
content.parenthetical: popping up behind Joey wearing an Indian headdress

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right! (He joins them in the fort and comes up putting on a bonnet.) Isn’t this a woman’s hat?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude, stop talking crazy and make us some tea!
(Chandler does so.)

[The next one is from Episode 417: The One With The Free Porn, Chandler and Joey are lamenting the fact that every beautiful woman they see doesn’t want to have sex right then and there like in porn.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what, we have to turn off the porn.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I think you’re right.
(Goes over and picks up the remote.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, ready?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: One.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Two.

content.speaker: Both
content.text: Three.
(Chandler turns off the porn and sets the remote down.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s kinda nice.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, that’s kinda a relief.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.
(Pause.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You wanna see if we still have it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.
(Chandler turns on the TV and…)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: FREE PORN!!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We have free porn here!!!
[Cut to the interview.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: In my spare time I uh, read to the blind. And I’m also a mento for the kids.(The gang shake their heads.) Y’know a mento, a role model. (Chandler bites his fist to keep from talking.)

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: A mento…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Right.

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: Like the candy?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Matter of fact, I do.
(Chandler tries to jump over the couch but everyone stops him.)

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: Well umm, another thing our readers always want to know is how our soap stars stay in such great shape. Do you have some kind of fitness regime?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, we stars just try to eat right and get lots of exercise.
[Another set of flashbacks begin with Episode 521: The One With The Ball, Joey and Ross are throwing a ball around.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow! You realize that we’ve been throwing this ball, without dropping it, for like an hour?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you serious?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. I realized it about a half-hour ago but I didn’t want to say anything ’cause I didn’t want to jinx it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! We are pretty good at this!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! We totally forgot about lunch!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I-I, I think that’s the first time I ever missed a meal! (Checks his pants.) Yeah, my pants are a little loose!
[The next one is from Episode 604: The One Where Joey Loses His Insurance.]

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler enters to find Joey lying in the fetus position on the floor.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s wrong with you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nothing! Well, I-I got this blinding pain in my stomach when I was lifting weights before, then I uh passed out and uh, haven’t been able to stand up since. But um, I don’t think it’s anything serious.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This sounds like a hernia. You have to—you-you—Go to the doctor!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No way! ‘Kay look, if I have to go to the doctor for anything it’s gonna be for this thing sticking out of my stomach! (Rolls over and shows Chandler.) Why did I have to start working out again? (Looks at the weights he was using.) Damn you 15s!
[The next one is from Episode 609: The One Where Ross Got High, Rachel is describing her desert to Joey and Ross.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s a trifle. It’s got all of these layers. First there’s a layer of ladyfingers, then a layer of jam, then custard, which I made from scratch. [Joey and Ross make impressed faces] Then raspberries, more ladyfingers, then beef saut�ed with peas and onions, [Joey and Ross look like something’s wrong.] then a little more custard, and then bananas, and then I just put some whipped cream on top!
[Time lapse, Ross and Joey are eating Rachel’s disaster.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It tastes like feet!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I like it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you kidding?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s not to like? Custard? Good. Jam? Good. Meat? Goooooood.
[The next one is from Episode 619: The One With Joey’s Fridge.]

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s apartment, Chandler is entering to find Joey bingeing on the food from the fridge. Joey isn’t doing all that well.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The fridge broke. I have to eat everything. Cold cuts, ice cream, limes—Hey, what was in that brown jar?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s still in there?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not anymore.
[The next one is from Episode 711: The One With All the Cheesecakes.]

content.description: The Hallway, Chandler and Rachel are on their knees with forks trying to salvage what they can of the cheesecake off of the floor.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! Yay! Look! There’s a piece that doesn’t have floor on it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Stick to your side!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, come on now!
(Joey finishes climbing the stairs and sees them. Chandler and Rachel both stop and look up at him. Joey sits down on the step.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, what are we havin’? (Starts digging in.)
[Cut to the interview.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, I don’t believe in these crazy diets y’know, just everything in moderation.
Gunther: Your muffins. (Sets down a huge plate of muffins in front of Joey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’ll take those to go. (To the interviewer) For the kids.

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: Oh, I know what I wanted to ask you. You were on the show years ago and then they killed you off. What happened there?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It was so stupid, I said some stuff in an interview that I shouldn’t have said. But believe me, that’s not gonna happen today.

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: Understood. So, what’d you say back then?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I said that I… (The gang jumps up and interrupts him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You guys, this is Shelley, she’s interviewing me for Soap Opera Digest , and Shelley, this are my friends…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! I’m gal pal Rachel Green, and if you want the dirt, I’m the one you come too. This might be Joey’s baby (rubbing her stomach), who knows? I’m just kidding—Seriously, (leans into the cassette recorder Shelley is using) gal pal Rachel Green.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Who just lost the respect of her unborn child.
content.parenthetical: leaning into the recorder as well

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: Umm, I’m gonna just go get this warmed up. (She takes her coffee mug up to the counter.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey! You’re doing great!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, so far nothing stupid.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Mento?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No thanks.

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: So, as Joey’s friends, is there anything that you guys think our readers ought to know?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh no, no just-just that he is a great guy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, that’s gonna get you into Soap Opera Digest . Well I…(leans into the microphone again)…I would just like to say that Joey truly has enriched the days of our lives.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, I…I just think you don’t expect someone so hot to be so sweet.

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: Oh! I like that. What’s your name?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, Phoebe Buffay.

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: How do you spell that? So we can get it right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh okay, it’s P as in Phoebe, H as in hoebe, O as in oebe, E as in ebe, B as in bee-bee and E as in (In an Australian accent) ‘Ello there mate!

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: Great! Well, it was nice meeting all of you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, you too.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You too!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bye. (They resume their previous positions.)

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: So it seems like you have a lot of friends, who would you say is your best friend?

[They gang all lean back to listen better, and this starts another series of flashbacks. The first one is from Episode 214: The One With The Prom Video, Rachel has just found the bracelet that Joey gave Chandler, which is after he bought one to replace it.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How come you have two?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well this one’s for you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Get out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I can’t. No-no, listen, I, I know how much this means to you and I also know that this is about more than just jewelry, (Puts bracelet on Joey) it’s about you and me and the fact that we’re (Reading bracelet) best buds.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow, is this friendship? I think so. Check it out, we’re bracelet buddies.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s what they’ll call us. [The next one is from Episode 618: The One Where Ross Dates A Student.]

content.description: Joey’s apartment, Joey and Rachel are eating spaghetti in the living room while watching TV and Rachel drops some on the floor.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, Joey! Sorry!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No that’s all right. Don’t worry about it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh but look! That’s gonna leave a stain!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Rach! Hey! It’s fine! You’re at Joey’s!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Look! (He throws some of his spaghetti on the floor.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’ve never lived like this before.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know.
(Rachel throws some of hers down.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, don’t waste it, I mean its still food. (He picks it up and eats it.)
[The next one is from Episode 224: The One With Barry And Mindy’s Wedding, Joey has to kiss a guy in an audition and has been trying to find one to practice with.]

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is reading a script as Ross enters

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right I’ve been feeling incredibly guilty about this, because I wanna be a good friend, and damnit I am a good friend. So just, just shut up and close your eyes (kisses Joey).

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow, you are a good friend, ’course the audition was this morning, and I didn’t get it. But that was a hell of a kiss. Rachel is a very lucky girl.
[The next one is from Episode 512: The One With Chandler’s Work Laugh, Joey and Phoebe are betting on who will reach the treat the fastest, the chick or the duck.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right. Let’s get the contestants out of their isolation booths. (He removes the waste bucket that’s over the duck and the laundry basket that’s over the chicken.) And they’re off! (He puts his foot in front of the chick, stopping it from moving.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Get your foot off my contestant! Judge!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Judge rules, no violation.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohhh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And the duck gets the Nutter-Butter!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No!! Hey-hey that’s not a Nutter-Butter, that’s just an old Wonton!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Judge rules, Nutter-Butter.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, tough call.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.
[The next one is from Episode 401: The One With The Jellyfish, where Monica, Joey, and Chandler are relating that tragic day they spent on the beach.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’d seen this thing on The Discovery Channel ...

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait a minute! I saw that! On The Discovery Channel , yeah! About jellyfish and how if you... (Stops suddenly and turns to look at Monica) Ewwww!! You peed on yourself?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ewwww!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You can’t say that!! You-you don’t know!! I mean I thought I was gonna pass out from the pain! Anyway I-I tried, but I-I couldn’t...bend that way. So... (Looks at Joey.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ewwww!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s right I stepped up! She’s my friend and she needed help! And if I had too, I’d pee on anyone of you!
[Cut to the interview.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Umm, no. No best friend, no. Just a lot of close friends.

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: So umm, now back to the show. How does it feel to have a huge gay fan base?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really? Me? Wow! I don’t even know any huge gay people!
[Cut to the gang.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It hurts me. It physically hurts me.
[Cut to the interview.]

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: Now, off the record, you’re not…
[Another group of flashbacks begin with Episode 513: The One With Joey’s Bag. Joey is carrying the bag and has entered Central Perk to the amusement of Ross and Chandler.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What? Are you referring to my man’s bag? At first, I thought it just looked good, but it’s practical too. Check it out! It’s got compartments for all your stuff! Your wallet! Your keys! Your address book!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Your make-up!
[The next one is from Episode 712: The One Where They’re Up All Night, Joey and Ross are deciding how to climb down the final part of the fire escape.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. Now-now-now should I climb down your front so we’re face to face or-or should I climb down your back so we’re-we’re butt to face.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I think face to face.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I would say that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Face to face, yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, here I go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right.
(Ross steps onto the bottom rung of the ladder and then steps on Joey’s chest.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my… How much do you weigh Ross?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I prefer not to answer that right now, I’m still carrying a little holiday weight.

(Ross continues to climb down. He puts his other foot further down on Joey’s torso, but that doesn’t work very well and he’s forced to wrap his legs around Joey. Which then forces Joey to get a nice and close view of Ross’s crotch.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know, when we talked about face to face, I don’t think we thought it all the way through.
[The next one is from Episode 722: The One With Chandler’s Dad.]

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is sitting on the couch as Joey enters strutting.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Pheebs! (He sits down next to her.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Check it out. (He turns around, pulls down his pants, and shows Phoebe that he’s got panties on.) How much of a man am I?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! Nice! Manly and also kind of a slut.
[The next one is from Episode 608: The One With Ross’s Teeth, Chandler is accusing Joey of becoming less of a man.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’re turning into a woman.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No I’m not. Why would you say that? That’s just mean.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Now I’ve upset you? What did I say?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s not what you said. It’s the way you said it… Oh My God, I’m a woman!!!
[The next one is from Episode 706: The One With The Nap Partners.]

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey and Ross are napping together again and both wake up at the same time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Great nap.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It really was.
(Suddenly Rachel clears her throat and the camera cuts to the rest of the gang staring at them. Needless to say Joey and Ross are shocked and slowly turn their heads to see the gang.)
[Cut to the interview.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh me? Gay? No! No. No, but I have a number of close friends who are. (Chandler and Ross look at each other.)

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: So, let’s talk about women. I’m sure our female readers will be interested to know about your romantic life.
[Another series of flashbacks begins with Episode 413: The One With Rachel’s Crush, Joey is telling Rachel and Phoebe how he picks up women.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-oh-oh-oh, how I do it is, I look a woman up and down and say, “Hey, how you doin’?”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, please!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, how you doin’?
(Phoebe looks at him, and then giggles and looks away.)
[The next one is from Episode 605: The One With Joey’s Porsche.]

content.description: The street, Joey is messing with a car cover and still wearing the Porsche stuff. This guy playing street football catches a pass next to the car cover Joey is fooling around with.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! How you doin’?

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: He has the most amazing Porsche under there!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’d love to show ya, but I just tucked her in. She’s sleeping. (The women both laugh) Hey uh, would you two girls like to go for a drink? (Just then the same guy with the football dives to make a catch, lands on the car cover, and collapses it. It turns out that Joey set up a bunch of boxes to make it look like a Porsche.)
[The next one is from Episode 613: The One With Rachel’s Sister, Chandler has just opened the door to reveal a woman standing there.]

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Hi, is Rachel here? I’m her sister.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, Jill!

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Oh my God, Rachel!
(They run and hug each other.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God, introduce us!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: This is Chandler. (Points at him.)

content.speaker: Jill
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And you know Monica and Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi Jill.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And that’s Phoebe (points), and that’s Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, (in the Joey voice) how you doin’?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Don’t!! (Joey backs away frightened.)
[The final one is from Episode 607: The One Where Phoebe Runs, Joey has been trying to repel Janice and sees it’s not working to his liking so he’s confronting her about the sexual tension.]

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: No! I mean you’re a really nice guy and I’m happy to be your roommate and your friend, I’m just y’know, I just don’t feel that way about you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh! I see what happened. It’s because I was trying to repel you. Right? Believe me, you’d feel a lot different if I turned it on.

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I do. (Gives her the Joey-love look.) How you doin?

content.speaker: Janine
content.text: I’m okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!?! Oh dear God!
[Cut to the interview.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Not much to tell there I’m really shy.
(The gang is confused.)

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: So, that’s it. I guess that’s all I need. Thank you so much. I think they will be running this in the beginning of next month.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh great! Great! Thank you. (They shake hands.)

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Bye-bye. (The interviewer leaves and he sits down with the rest of the gang.) I did it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Amazing! Amazing!

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: Oh wait! I almost forgot. We have to ask everybody this. Other than Days of Our Lives , what’s your favorite soap opera?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I don’t watch soap operas. Excuse me, I have a life, y’know?
(The gang is disappointed.)

content.speaker: The Interviewer
content.text: Thank you. The readers at Soap Opera Digest will be happy to hear that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, good to know. (The interviewer leaves.) So close!

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, everyone is reading Joey’s interview.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! I can’t believe they didn’t put it in the part where you said you didn’t watch soap operas.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I called the lady about that. I told her I was just joking. She was pretty nice about that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You slept with her didn’t you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Little bit, yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow! This picture of you sure is steamy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, that’s just a little something for my huge gay fan base. (Winks at him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Did you just wink at me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, you’re the one that loves the picture.
